intro: Witheringia coccoloboides, commonly known as the yellow-leafed hibiscus, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, smooth seeds. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Witheringia coccoloboides is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some indigenous cultures.
